title: Molecular mechanisms and therapeutic potential of quercetin in ovarian functions.
abstract: Quercetin is a naturally occurring flavonoid abundant in various fruits and vegetables, known for its broad pharmacological properties, including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, anti-apoptotic, and anti-fibrotic effects. Emerging evidence suggests that quercetin exerts protective roles in a range of ovarian-related reproductive disorders.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
